name: YetAnotherModMenu
description: The Smallest Free Geode Mod Menu!

best-percent-header.name: Best Percent in Percentage Label
best-percent-header.description: You are responsible for all problems if you enable this while similar features from other mod menus are enabled.

customSeparator.name: Custom Best Percent Separator
customSeparator.description: <cy>Not all options may be available for all fonts seen in the level editor; choose carefully!</c>

wave-pulse-header.name: Wave Trail Pulse
wave-pulse-header.description: You are responsible for all problems if you enable this while similar features from other mod menus are enabled.

wavePulseSize.name: Wave Trail Width
wavePulseSize.description: The higher the number, the thicker the trail.

addMinumumWidth.name: Add Minimum Width to Wave Width

player-trail-header.name: Player Trail (Length + Blending)
player-trail-header.description: You are responsible for all problems if you enable this while similar features from other mod menus are enabled.

trailLengthModifier.name: Trail Length Modifier
trailLengthModifier.description: The higher the number, the longer the trail. Set to 0.0 to disable, or to 1.0 to mimic vanilla behavior when inside a level.

blendingTrailMode.name: Trail Blending Mode (READ!)
blendingTrailMode.description:
- <cl>Disabled</c>: Disables this feature.
- <cl>hiimmoreicons</c>: Emulates the blending style from More Icons by hiimjasmine00.
- <cl>TheSolidQOLMod</c>: Emulates the blending style from QOLMod by TheSillyDoggo.
- <cl>Outlinemanthus</c>: Adds a black outline to the player trail.
- <cl>Invertmanthus</c>: Invert blending.
- <cl>Additive</c>: Additive blending.

Requires re-entering a level to apply.

garageInPauseMenu.name: Icon Kit In Pause Menu
garageInPauseMenu.description:
<cl>Made with <3 and massive help from km7.</c>

## <cy>If you click on the Soggy Mod button from the icon kit in the pause menu,</c> <c-ff0000>__you can *very likely* be kicked out of the level you paused on!__</c>

coin-tracing-header.name: Coin Path Tracing
coin-tracing-header.description: You are responsible for all problems if you enable this while similar features from other mod menus are enabled.

traceCoins.name: Coin Pathfinder
traceCoins.description: Draws a straight line from the player's position to all the coins in the current level.

coinTracingDisabledCoin.name: Color a Path Red if Its Coin is Toggled Off (READ!)
coinTracingDisabledCoin.description: If <cg>enabled</c>, the path for a <c_>***__disabled__***</c> coin will be colored <c_>***__RED__***</c>, overriding your preferences.

colorMode.name: Coin Path Color Mode
colorMode.description:
Options:

- Custom: Choose a color of your own choice for all coin paths, regardless of the coin's traits.
- Match Coin Status (default): The path of the coin will reflect the coin's traits: <c-ffd700>gold</c> for coins in official levels, <c-bbbbbb>silver</c> for verified coins or coins in editor levels, or <c-ff0000>red</c> if the "Color Path Red if Coin is Toggled Off" setting is <cg>enabled</c> ***__regardless of the type of coin being tracked.__***.

coinTracingOpacityModifiers.name: Conditional Coin Path Opacity Modifiers (READ!)
coinTracingOpacityModifiers.description:
If <cg>enabled</c>, the opacities of paths to the following kinds of coins are reduced:

- previously collected coins
- coins you missed in levels with directional changes.

<cy>Unfortunately, this does not apply to</c> <c-A56E32>bronze/unverified</c> <cy>coins.</c>
<cy>Opacity modifiers stack.</c>

previouslyCollectedModifier.name: Opacity Modifier for Previously Collected Coins
previouslyCollectedModifier.description: Since this detection is only 95% accurate, this modifier is disabled by default.

coinTraceOpacity.name: Coin Path Opacity (For "Match Coin Status" Coin Path Color Mode)

colorFromSettings.name: Color + Opacity (For "Custom" Coin Path Color Mode)

menu-pulsing-header.name: Pulsing Node in Main Menu
menu-pulsing-header.description: You are responsible for all problems if you enable this while similar features from other mod menus are enabled.

pulseMenuTitle.name: Pulsing Menu Node
pulseMenuTitle.description: Pulses the title sprite (by default, otherwise a node of your choice) on MenuLayer to the current background music.

pulseModID.name: Mod ID Prefix for Pulsing Menu Node
pulseModID.description: Include the mod ID prefix of the node ID you want to pulse to the menu loop. <cy>Mod IDs are case-sensitive.</c>

pulseNodeID.name: Node ID for Pulsing Menu Node
pulseNodeID.description: Choose a node that will pulse to the menu loop. <cy>Node IDs are case-sensitive.</c>

pulseScaleFactor.name: Pulsing Menu Node Scale Factor
pulseScaleFactor.description: The higher the number, the larger the scale. Adjust as needed depending on the Node ID you chose.

pulseUseSTDLerp.name: Smooth Node Pulsing
pulseUseSTDLerp.description: Smoothly pulses the node of your choice, like QOLMod. If disabled, switch to a more "impactful" pulsing/scaling effect.

pulsePulseFactor.name: Non-Smooth Node Pulsing Factor
pulsePulseFactor.description:
<cp>DISABLE "Smooth Node Pulsing" TO USE THIS SETTING.</c>

The higher the number, the lower the extent of the pulsing. Adjust as needed depending on the Node ID you chose.

filthy-header.name: Fire in the Hoie
filthy-header.description: You are responsible for all problems if you enable this while similar features from other mod menus are enabled.

filth.name: Fire in Lava/the Hole (FiL/tH)
filth.description: Replaces all SFX with (by default) that "Fire in the HoIe" SFX that totally won't age poorly 10 years from now. (Or any SFX of your choice.)
